text:
Does beg the question of whether these UI Extensions can be used in Public Apps or only private ones for now?

Second question, more of a confirmation… we need to make requests using the serverless function, even if that serverless function is just hitting a separate API/serverless function that does all of the data transformation needed?

(We’re effectively doing the same thing by putting the transformation logic for the CRM Extension data into a serverless function; so instead of just pointing the HubSpot Extension to _our_ serverless function, we’d need to point the UI Extension to the Serverless function which _itself_ makes the request to our serverless fucntion)
Maybe an <@U2H3TT8F2> or <@UQNEXHW14> question (I’ve not seen any answer to this ^^ in any of the announcements or docs, just sort’ve migration tips, focused on private apps)

> Second question, more of a confirmation… we need to make requests using the serverless function, even if that serverless function is just hitting a separate API/serverless function that does all of the data transformation needed?
That's right. You can find more over here in the docs page <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-overview#limitations>

> Does beg the question of whether these UI Extensions can be used in Public Apps or only private ones for now?
At the moment this is only available for private apps. Do you work with a marketplace app partner?
I could see some great use of this being added to public apps.
